info.name: JEP 472 - Prepare to Restrict the Use of JNI
info.dscr: Issues warnings on uses of the Java Native Interface (JNI) to prepare for future restrictions, enhancing platform integrity by requiring explicit opt-in.

info.name: JEP 475 - Late Barrier Expansion for G1
info.dscr: Moves G1 garbage collector barrier expansion to the code emission phase in C2 JIT to reduce overhead and improve maintainability.

info.name: JEP 478 - Key Derivation Function API (Preview)
info.dscr: A preview of the KDF API. The final implementation is in JEP 510 for Java 25.

info.name: JEP 484 - Class-File API
info.dscr: Finalizes the API for parsing, generating, and transforming Java class files.

info.name: JEP 485 - Stream Gatherers
info.dscr: Enhance the Stream API to support custom intermediate operations. This will allow stream pipelines to transform data in ways that are not easily achievable with the existing built-in intermediate operations.

info.name: JEP 486 - Permanently Disable the Security Manager
info.dscr: The Security Manager API, deprecated for removal in earlier releases, has now been permanently disabled. Any attempt to set a Security Manager will result in an UnsupportedOperationException.

info.name: JEP 490 - ZGC: Remove the Non-Generational Mode
info.dscr: Removes the non-generational mode of the Z Garbage Collector (ZGC), making the generational mode the only option. This change simplifies long-term maintenance and focuses development efforts on the more efficient generational model.

info.name: JEP 491 - Synchronize Virtual Threads without Pinning
info.dscr: Improves scalability by allowing virtual threads to unmount from their carrier platform thread when blocked in 'synchronized' methods, eliminating a major source of thread pinning.

info.name: JEP 493 - Linking Run-Time Images without JMODs
info.dscr: Simplifies jlink by removing the need for JMOD files. Developers can now link custom runtime images directly from modular JARs, streamlining the build process.

info.name: JEP 495 - Simple Source Files and Instance Main Methods (Fourth Preview)
JEP 496 - Quantum Resistant Algorithm - Lattice-based Key Encapsulation
info.dscr: Provides a lattice-based key encapsulation mechanism to support quantum-resistant key exchanges; see QuantumResistantModuleLatticeBasedKeyEncapsulation.java

info.name: JEP 497 - Quantum Resistant Algorithm - Lattice-based Digital Signature (Preview)
info.dscr: Provides a lattice-based digital signature algorithm to support quantum-resistant signatures; see QuantumResistantModule.java

info.name: JEP 498 - Warn upon Use of Memory-Access Methods in sun.misc.Unsafe
info.dscr: Showing runtime warnings for methods that are already deprecated

info.name: JEP 479 - Remove the 32-bit x86 Windows Port
info.dscr: Removed support for the 32-bit x86 port on Windows in JDK 24, while keeping other OS ports available.

info.name: JEP 501 - Deprecate the 32-bit x86 Port for Removal
info.dscr: Deprecated the entire 32-bit x86 port in JDK 24, warning of its complete removal in JDK 25.
